intro: Cirsium eriophorum degenii, commonly known as the Degen's thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, purple to pinkish flower heads. Native to certain regions of Europe, this plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with rough, hairy surfaces, and the plant produces achene fruits that are dispersed by wind. Cirsium eriophorum degenii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor nutritional conditions.
